isis.stitle: 530 and DT-466/408 Diesel Engine Service (1994) - ROCKER ARM ASSEMBLY, CAMSHAFT, TAPPETS AND PUSH RODS - CAMSHAFT, TAPPETS & PUSH RODS - CAMSHAFT BUSHING INSTALLATION

step1.para: Identify each bushing by its outside diameter. Refer to the " CAMSHAFT BUSHING CHART" which appears earlier in this section.
Lubricate new camshaft bushings as well as crankcase bushing bore with clean engine oil.

Install new bushing onto expanding collet and tighten collet by turning backup nut until bushing is held securely. Refer to Figure 5.25
.

Mark oil hole location on back-up nut of installation tool to aid in alignment of bushing and crankcase oil holes. Refer to Figure 5.26
.

note.para: This step must be repeated for each bushing installed.

step1.para: Install rear intermediate bushing through front of crankcase, then pull it into place at rear of crankcase by turning pulling nut on puller screw. Remove tool and inspect oil hole alignment.

important.para: THE BUSHINGS MUST BE INSTALLED IN THE PROPER ORDER BECAUSE OF THE DIFFERENT SIZE OUTSIDE DIAMETERS OF THE BUSHINGS.

step1.para:
Install front intermediate bushing next. Install through front of crankcase and pull into place from rear. Refer to Figure 5.27
.
Next install front camshaft bushing by pulling it into place from rear.
The rear camshaft bushing must be pulled into place from front of crankcase.

important.para: ALL BUSHING OIL HOLES MUST BE IN ALIGNMENT WITH OIL HOLES IN CRANKCASE.
